title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to subreport
text: outlines propose change subreport.

title: Contributing to subreport
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to subreport
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to subreport
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to subreport
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to subreport
text: Please note subreport project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with subreport
text: Thanks using subreport! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with subreport
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with subreport
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thorley J (2025). subreport: Generate Reports 'subfoldr2' Objects. R package version 0.0.0.9018.
code: @Manual{,   title = {subreport: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects},   author = {Joe Thorley},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9018}, }

title: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects
text: subreport R package generate .html results reports custom markdown tables, figures (plots, windows png files) (code) blocks saved using subfoldr2 package. sbr_knit_results() function allows user view .html report tables, figures blocks sbr_tables(), sbr_figures() sbr_blocks() functions produce markdown code complete headings, numbered labels captions respective objects. sbr_n() sbr_s() functions allow numbers strings inserted .Rmd reports.

title: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects
code: library(subfoldr2) library(subreport)  sbf_set_main(tempdir(), "output") sbr_set_report(tempdir(), "report")  y <- data.frame(t = 2, comment = "blah blah") sbf_save_table(y, sub = "Factoids", caption = "A really interesting summary")  cat(sbr_tables()) #>  #> #### Factoids #>  #> Table 1. A really interesting summary. #>  #> |  t|comment   | #> |--:|:---------| #> |  2|blah blah |

title: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects
text: install latest development version GitHub repository

title: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects
text: Please report issues. Pull requests always welcome.

title: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects
text: Please note subreport project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Blocks — sbr_blocks
text: Returns string report code blocks markdown format ready inclusion report.

title: Blocks — sbr_blocks
code: sbr_blocks(   x_name = ".*",   sub = character(0),   report = sbr_get_report(),   tag = ".*",   drop = NULL,   sort = NULL,   rename = NULL,   nheaders = 2L,   header1 = 4L,   main = subfoldr2::sbf_get_main() )

title: Blocks — sbr_blocks
text: x_name string regular expression match file names. sub string path root sub folder. report string path report folder. tag string regular expression tag must match included. drop character vector specifying sub folders file names exclude report NULL. sort character vector specifying initial sort order sub folders file names NULL. Missing items appear afterwards alphabetical order. rename unique named character vector specifying new heading names sub folders NULL. default sub folder names first letter word capitalized. nheaders count number sub folder levels assign headers . header1 count heading level first sub folder level. main string path main folder.

title: Blocks — sbr_blocks
text: string code blocks markdown format.

title: Figures — sbr_figures
text: Returns string report plots windows markdown format ready inclusion report. window plot identical names plot dropped.

title: Figures — sbr_figures
code: sbr_figures(   x_name = ".*",   sub = character(0),   report = sbr_get_report(),   tag = ".*",   drop = NULL,   sort = NULL,   rename = NULL,   nheaders = 2L,   header1 = 4L,   main = subfoldr2::sbf_get_main(),   width = 6,   pre_num = getOption("sbr.pre_num_fig", 0L) )

title: Figures — sbr_figures
text: x_name string regular expression match file names. sub string path root sub folder. report string path report folder. tag string regular expression tag must match included. drop character vector specifying sub folders file names exclude report NULL. sort character vector specifying initial sort order sub folders file names NULL. Missing items appear afterwards alphabetical order. rename unique named character vector specifying new heading names sub folders NULL. default sub folder names first letter word capitalized. nheaders count number sub folder levels assign headers . header1 count heading level first sub folder level. main string path main folder. width number page width inches. pre_num count specifying number pre-existing items.

title: Figures — sbr_figures
text: string plots markdown format.

title: Get Report — sbr_get_report
text: Get Report

title: Get Report — sbr_get_report
text: string specifying report directory.

title: Knit Report — sbr_knit_results
text: Makes results .Rmd file tables, code blocks plots (windows) knits .html file opens default web browser.

title: Knit Report — sbr_knit_results
code: sbr_knit_results(   file = "results",   report = sbr_get_report(),   sub = character(0),   main = subfoldr2::sbf_get_main(),   quiet = FALSE,   browse = TRUE )

title: Knit Report — sbr_knit_results
text: file string file name(s) without extension. report string directory save tables, code blocks plots. sub string specifying path sub folder (default current sub folder). main string specifying path main folder (default current main folder) quiet option suppress printing rendering knitr, pandoc command line others. suppress printing last "Output created: " message, can set rmarkdown.render.message FALSE browse flag specifying whether open .html file web browser.

title: Knit Report — sbr_knit_results
text: invisible path .Rmd file.

code: sbr_number(x_name, sub = character(0))  sbr_n(x_name, sub = character(0))

title: Get Number — sbr_number
text: x_name string name. sub string specifying path sub folder (default current sub folder).

title: Get Number — sbr_number
text: number.

title: Set Report — sbr_set_report

code: sbr_strings(   x_name = ".*",   sub = character(0),   report = sbr_get_report(),   tag = ".*",   drop = NULL,   sort = NULL,   rename = NULL,   nheaders = 2L,   header1 = 4L,   numbered = FALSE,   main = subfoldr2::sbf_get_main() )

title: Strings — sbr_strings
text: x_name string regular expression match file names. sub string path root sub folder. report string path report folder. tag string regular expression tag must match included. drop character vector specifying sub folders file names exclude report NULL. sort character vector specifying initial sort order sub folders file names NULL. Missing items appear afterwards alphabetical order. rename unique named character vector specifying new heading names sub folders NULL. default sub folder names first letter word capitalized. nheaders count number sub folder levels assign headers . header1 count heading level first sub folder level. numbered flag specifying whether list(s) items numbered. main string path main folder.

title: Strings — sbr_strings
text: string code blocks markdown format.

title: Tables — sbr_tables
text: Returns string report tables markdown format ready inclusion report.

title: Tables — sbr_tables
code: sbr_tables(   x_name = ".*",   sub = character(0),   report = sbr_get_report(),   tag = ".*",   drop = NULL,   sort = NULL,   rename = NULL,   nheaders = 2L,   header1 = 4L,   main = subfoldr2::sbf_get_main(),   sigfig = 3L,   sigfig_override = NULL )

title: Tables — sbr_tables
text: x_name string regular expression match file names. sub string path root sub folder. report string path report folder. tag string regular expression tag must match included. drop character vector specifying sub folders file names exclude report NULL. sort character vector specifying initial sort order sub folders file names NULL. Missing items appear afterwards alphabetical order. rename unique named character vector specifying new heading names sub folders NULL. default sub folder names first letter word capitalized. nheaders count number sub folder levels assign headers . header1 count heading level first sub folder level. main string path main folder. sigfig positive integer significant figures use formatting numbers. applied tables. sigfig_override named vector table names number significant figures use. override default set `sigfig` matching tables.

title: Tables — sbr_tables
text: string tables markdown format.

what: subreport: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects — subreport-package
title: subreport: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects — subreport-package
text: Facilitates generation .Rmd .html reports tables, (code) blocks figures (plots windows) saved using subfoldr2 package. quickly view results use `sbr_knit_results()`. `sbr_n()` `sbr_s()` functions can used insert numbers strings saved using subfoldr2.

title: subreport: Generate Reports from `subfoldr2` Objects — subreport-package
text: Maintainer: Joe Thorley joe@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) contributors: Poisson Consulting [copyright holder, funder]

title: subreport 0.0.0.9018
text: Add functionality sbr_table() control significant figures numeric columns data.frame prior converting markdown table report. New argumentssigfig sigfig_override set default significant figures significant figures specific table, respectively.

title: subreport 0.0.0.9017
text: Fixed Windows, versus Mac Linux, path format sbr_knit_results().

title: subreport 0.0.0.9016
text: Add extra line break model blocks ensure correct PDF wrapping behaviour poisreport.

title: subreport 0.0.0.9015
text: Added pre_num argument sbr_figures(). sbr_number() sbr_string() now return NULL number string doesn’t exist. Replaced err chk dependency. Removed sbr_database().

title: subreport 0.0.0.9014
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
